reporting-org.narrative: Norad - Norwegian Agency for Development Cooperation

title.narrative: Roots of Health - Supporting Women and Young People's Access to Sexual and Reproductive Health Rights

description.narrative:
This project will empower and support women and young people in Palawan to realize their sexual and reproductive health rights in the midst and aftermath of the COVID-19 crisis. The project will have three main components: 1) Provide access to services - Restore and strengthen access to sexual and reproductive health services, including pre-and post-natal care and HIV screening through their clinics and community outreach to Puerto Princesa’s Barangay Health Centers.
2) Improve health communication - Mobilize women at the community level to ensure that public health education messages on risk and prevention strategies for COVID-19, reproductive health and general health are reaching all women and young people 3) Strengthen women’s leadership - Strengthen the leadership and meaningful participation of women in decision-making processes in addressing the COVID-19 outbreak by training and empowering one Community Health Advocate (CHA) in each of the barangays Roots of Health support.
Roots of Health (ROH) has been supporting sexual and reproductive health rights in Palawan for the last 10 and a half years and they are well-placed now to provide support to the City Health Office to ensure that women and young people can continue to access essential reproductive health care services during and beyond the health crisis brought on by the coronavirus.
